11   /** @public */
12   export declare abstract class AbstractCursor<TSchema = any, CursorEvents extends AbstractCursorEvents = AbstractCursorEvents> extends TypedEventEmitter<CursorEvents> {
13       /* Excluded from this release type: [kId] */
14       /* Excluded from this release type: [kSession] */
15       /* Excluded from this release type: [kServer] */
16       /* Excluded from this release type: [kNamespace] */
17       /* Excluded from this release type: [kDocuments] */
18       /* Excluded from this release type: [kClient] */
19       /* Excluded from this release type: [kTransform] */
20       /* Excluded from this release type: [kInitialized] */
21       /* Excluded from this release type: [kClosed] */
22       /* Excluded from this release type: [kKilled] */
23       /* Excluded from this release type: [kOptions] */
24       /** @event */
25       static readonly CLOSE: "close";
26       /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
27       get id(): Long | undefined;
28       /* Excluded from this release type: isDead */
29       /* Excluded from this release type: client */
30       /* Excluded from this release type: server */
31       get namespace(): MongoDBNamespace;
32       get readPreference(): ReadPreference;
33       get readConcern(): ReadConcern | undefined;
34       /* Excluded from this release type: session */
35       /* Excluded from this release type: session */
36       /* Excluded from this release type: cursorOptions */
37       get closed(): boolean;
38       get killed(): boolean;
39       get loadBalanced(): boolean;
40       /** Returns current buffered documents length */
41       bufferedCount(): number;
42       /** Returns current buffered documents */
43       readBufferedDocuments(number?: number): TSchema[];
44       [Symbol.asyncIterator](): AsyncGenerator<TSchema, void, void>;
45       stream(options?: CursorStreamOptions): Readable & AsyncIterable<TSchema>;
46       hasNext(): Promise<boolean>;
47       /** Get the next available document from the cursor, returns null if no more documents are available. */
48       next(): Promise<TSchema | null>;
49       /**
50        * Try to get the next available document from the cursor or `null` if an empty batch is returned
51        */
52       tryNext(): Promise<TSchema | null>;
53       /**
54        * Iterates over all the documents for this cursor using the iterator, callback pattern.
55        *
56        * If the iterator returns `false`, iteration will stop.
57        *
58        * @param iterator - The iteration callback.
59        * @deprecated - Will be removed in a future release. Use for await...of instead.
60        */
61       forEach(iterator: (doc: TSchema) => boolean | void): Promise<void>;
62       close(): Promise<void>;
63       /**
64        * Returns an array of documents. The caller is responsible for making sure that there
65        * is enough memory to store the results. Note that the array only contains partial
66        * results when this cursor had been previously accessed. In that case,
67        * cursor.rewind() can be used to reset the cursor.
68        */
69       toArray(): Promise<TSchema[]>;
70       /**
71        * Add a cursor flag to the cursor
72        *
73        * @param flag - The flag to set, must be one of following ['tailable', 'oplogReplay', 'noCursorTimeout', 'awaitData', 'partial' -.
74        * @param value - The flag boolean value.
75        */
76       addCursorFlag(flag: CursorFlag, value: boolean): this;
77       /**
78        * Map all documents using the provided function
79        * If there is a transform set on the cursor, that will be called first and the result passed to
80        * this function's transform.
81        *
82        * @remarks
83        *
84        * **Note** Cursors use `null` internally to indicate that there are no more documents in the cursor. Providing a mapping
85        * function that maps values to `null` will result in the cursor closing itself before it has finished iterating
86        * all documents.  This will **not** result in a memory leak, just surprising behavior.  For example:
87        *
88        * ```typescript
89        * const cursor = collection.find({});
90        * cursor.map(() => null);
91        *
92        * const documents = await cursor.toArray();
93        * // documents is always [], regardless of how many documents are in the collection.
94        * ```
95        *
96        * Other falsey values are allowed:
97        *
98        * ```typescript
99        * const cursor = collection.find({});
100       * cursor.map(() => '');
101       *
102       * const documents = await cursor.toArray();
103       * // documents is now an array of empty strings
104       * ```
105       *
106       * **Note for Typescript Users:** adding a transform changes the return type of the iteration of this cursor,
107       * it **does not** return a new instance of a cursor. This means when calling map,
108       * you should always assign the result to a new variable in order to get a correctly typed cursor variable.
109       * Take note of the following example:
110       *
111       * @example
112       * ```typescript
113       * const cursor: FindCursor<Document> = coll.find();
114       * const mappedCursor: FindCursor<number> = cursor.map(doc => Object.keys(doc).length);
115       * const keyCounts: number[] = await mappedCursor.toArray(); // cursor.toArray() still returns Document[]
116       * ```
117       * @param transform - The mapping transformation method.
118       */
119      map<T = any>(transform: (doc: TSchema) => T): AbstractCursor<T>;
120      /**
121       * Set the ReadPreference for the cursor.
122       *
123       * @param readPreference - The new read preference for the cursor.
124       */
125      withReadPreference(readPreference: ReadPreferenceLike): this;
126      /**
127       * Set the ReadPreference for the cursor.
128       *
129       * @param readPreference - The new read preference for the cursor.
130       */
131      withReadConcern(readConcern: ReadConcernLike): this;
132      /**
133       * Set a maxTimeMS on the cursor query, allowing for hard timeout limits on queries (Only supported on MongoDB 2.6 or higher)
134       *
135       * @param value - Number of milliseconds to wait before aborting the query.
136       */
137      maxTimeMS(value: number): this;
138      /**
139       * Set the batch size for the cursor.
140       *
141       * @param value - The number of documents to return per batch. See {@link https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/command/find/|find command documentation}.
142       */
143      batchSize(value: number): this;
144      /**
145       * Rewind this cursor to its uninitialized state. Any options that are present on the cursor will
146       * remain in effect. Iterating this cursor will cause new queries to be sent to the server, even
147       * if the resultant data has already been retrieved by this cursor.
148       */
149      rewind(): void;
150      /**
151       * Returns a new uninitialized copy of this cursor, with options matching those that have been set on the current instance
152       */
153      abstract clone(): AbstractCursor<TSchema>;
154      /* Excluded from this release type: _initialize */
155      /* Excluded from this release type: getMore */
156      /* Excluded from this release type: [kInit] */
157  }

161      [AbstractCursor.CLOSE](): void;

164  /** @public */
165  export declare interface AbstractCursorOptions extends BSONSerializeOptions {
166      session?: ClientSession;
167      readPreference?: ReadPreferenceLike;
168      readConcern?: ReadConcernLike;
169      /**
170       * Specifies the number of documents to return in each response from MongoDB
171       */
172      batchSize?: number;
173      /**
174       * When applicable `maxTimeMS` controls the amount of time the initial command
175       * that constructs a cursor should take. (ex. find, aggregate, listCollections)
176       */
177      maxTimeMS?: number;
178      /**
179       * When applicable `maxAwaitTimeMS` controls the amount of time subsequent getMores
180       * that a cursor uses to fetch more data should take. (ex. cursor.next())
181       */
182      maxAwaitTimeMS?: number;
183      /**
184       * Comment to apply to the operation.
185       *
186       * In server versions pre-4.4, 'comment' must be string.  A server
187       * error will be thrown if any other type is provided.
188       *
189       * In server versions 4.4 and above, 'comment' can be any valid BSON type.
190       */
191      comment?: unknown;
192      /**
193       * By default, MongoDB will automatically close a cursor when the
194       * client has exhausted all results in the cursor. However, for [capped collections](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/core/capped-collections)
195       * you may use a Tailable Cursor that remains open after the client exhausts
196       * the results in the initial cursor.
197       */
198      tailable?: boolean;
199      /**
200       * If awaitData is set to true, when the cursor reaches the end of the capped collection,
201       * MongoDB blocks the query thread for a period of time waiting for new data to arrive.
202       * When new data is inserted into the capped collection, the blocked thread is signaled
203       * to wake up and return the next batch to the client.
204       */
205      awaitData?: boolean;
206      noCursorTimeout?: boolean;
207  }

221  /**
222   * The **Admin** class is an internal class that allows convenient access to
223   * the admin functionality and commands for MongoDB.
224   *
225   * **ADMIN Cannot directly be instantiated**
226   * @public
227   *
228   * @example
229   * ```ts
230   * import { MongoClient } from 'mongodb';
231   *
232   * const client = new MongoClient('mongodb://localhost:27017');
233   * const admin = client.db().admin();
234   * const dbInfo = await admin.listDatabases();
235   * for (const db of dbInfo.databases) {
236   *   console.log(db.name);
237   * }
238   * ```
239   */
240  export declare class Admin {
241      /* Excluded from this release type: s */
242      /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
243      /**
244       * Execute a command
245       *
246       * The driver will ensure the following fields are attached to the command sent to the server:
247       * - `lsid` - sourced from an implicit session or options.session
248       * - `$readPreference` - defaults to primary or can be configured by options.readPreference
249       * - `$db` - sourced from the name of this database
250       *
251       * If the client has a serverApi setting:
252       * - `apiVersion`
253       * - `apiStrict`
254       * - `apiDeprecationErrors`
255       *
256       * When in a transaction:
257       * - `readConcern` - sourced from readConcern set on the TransactionOptions
258       * - `writeConcern` - sourced from writeConcern set on the TransactionOptions
259       *
260       * Attaching any of the above fields to the command will have no effect as the driver will overwrite the value.
261       *
262       * @param command - The command to execute
263       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
264       */
265      command(command: Document, options?: RunCommandOptions): Promise<Document>;
266      /**
267       * Retrieve the server build information
268       *
269       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
270       */
271      buildInfo(options?: CommandOperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
272      /**
273       * Retrieve the server build information
274       *
275       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
276       */
277      serverInfo(options?: CommandOperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
278      /**
279       * Retrieve this db's server status.
280       *
281       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
282       */
283      serverStatus(options?: CommandOperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
284      /**
285       * Ping the MongoDB server and retrieve results
286       *
287       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
288       */
289      ping(options?: CommandOperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
290      /**
291       * Remove a user from a database
292       *
293       * @param username - The username to remove
294       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
295       */
296      removeUser(username: string, options?: RemoveUserOptions): Promise<boolean>;
297      /**
298       * Validate an existing collection
299       *
300       * @param collectionName - The name of the collection to validate.
301       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
302       */
303      validateCollection(collectionName: string, options?: ValidateCollectionOptions): Promise<Document>;
304      /**
305       * List the available databases
306       *
307       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
308       */
309      listDatabases(options?: ListDatabasesOptions): Promise<ListDatabasesResult>;
310      /**
311       * Get ReplicaSet status
312       *
313       * @param options - Optional settings for the command
314       */
315      replSetGetStatus(options?: CommandOperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
316  }

322  /** @public */
323  export declare interface AggregateOptions extends CommandOperationOptions {
324      /** allowDiskUse lets the server know if it can use disk to store temporary results for the aggregation (requires mongodb 2.6 \>). */
325      allowDiskUse?: boolean;
326      /** The number of documents to return per batch. See [aggregation documentation](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/command/aggregate). */
327      batchSize?: number;
328      /** Allow driver to bypass schema validation. */
329      bypassDocumentValidation?: boolean;
330      /** Return the query as cursor, on 2.6 \> it returns as a real cursor on pre 2.6 it returns as an emulated cursor. */
331      cursor?: Document;
332      /** specifies a cumulative time limit in milliseconds for processing operations on the cursor. MongoDB interrupts the operation at the earliest following interrupt point. */
333      maxTimeMS?: number;
334      /** The maximum amount of time for the server to wait on new documents to satisfy a tailable cursor query. */
335      maxAwaitTimeMS?: number;
336      /** Specify collation. */
337      collation?: CollationOptions;
338      /** Add an index selection hint to an aggregation command */
339      hint?: Hint;
340      /** Map of parameter names and values that can be accessed using $$var (requires MongoDB 5.0). */
341      let?: Document;
342      out?: string;
343  }

345  /**
346   * The **AggregationCursor** class is an internal class that embodies an aggregation cursor on MongoDB
347   * allowing for iteration over the results returned from the underlying query. It supports
348   * one by one document iteration, conversion to an array or can be iterated as a Node 4.X
349   * or higher stream
350   * @public
351   */
352  export declare class AggregationCursor<TSchema = any> extends AbstractCursor<TSchema> {
353      /* Excluded from this release type: [kPipeline] */
354      /* Excluded from this release type: [kOptions] */
355      /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
356      get pipeline(): Document[];
357      clone(): AggregationCursor<TSchema>;
358      map<T>(transform: (doc: TSchema) => T): AggregationCursor<T>;
359      /* Excluded from this release type: _initialize */
360      /** Execute the explain for the cursor */
361      explain(verbosity?: ExplainVerbosityLike): Promise<Document>;
362      /** Add a group stage to the aggregation pipeline */
363      group<T = TSchema>($group: Document): AggregationCursor<T>;
364      /** Add a limit stage to the aggregation pipeline */
365      limit($limit: number): this;
366      /** Add a match stage to the aggregation pipeline */
367      match($match: Document): this;
368      /** Add an out stage to the aggregation pipeline */
369      out($out: {
370          db: string;
371          coll: string;
372      } | string): this;
373      /**
374       * Add a project stage to the aggregation pipeline
375       *
376       * @remarks
377       * In order to strictly type this function you must provide an interface
378       * that represents the effect of your projection on the result documents.
379       *
380       * By default chaining a projection to your cursor changes the returned type to the generic {@link Document} type.
381       * You should specify a parameterized type to have assertions on your final results.
382       *
383       * @example
384       * ```typescript
385       * // Best way
386       * const docs: AggregationCursor<{ a: number }> = cursor.project<{ a: number }>({ _id: 0, a: true });
387       * // Flexible way
388       * const docs: AggregationCursor<Document> = cursor.project({ _id: 0, a: true });
389       * ```
390       *
391       * @remarks
392       * In order to strictly type this function you must provide an interface
393       * that represents the effect of your projection on the result documents.
394       *
395       * **Note for Typescript Users:** adding a transform changes the return type of the iteration of this cursor,
396       * it **does not** return a new instance of a cursor. This means when calling project,
397       * you should always assign the result to a new variable in order to get a correctly typed cursor variable.
398       * Take note of the following example:
399       *
400       * @example
401       * ```typescript
402       * const cursor: AggregationCursor<{ a: number; b: string }> = coll.aggregate([]);
403       * const projectCursor = cursor.project<{ a: number }>({ _id: 0, a: true });
404       * const aPropOnlyArray: {a: number}[] = await projectCursor.toArray();
405       *
406       * // or always use chaining and save the final cursor
407       *
408       * const cursor = coll.aggregate().project<{ a: string }>({
409       *   _id: 0,
410       *   a: { $convert: { input: '$a', to: 'string' }
411       * }});
412       * ```
413       */
414      project<T extends Document = Document>($project: Document): AggregationCursor<T>;
415      /** Add a lookup stage to the aggregation pipeline */
416      lookup($lookup: Document): this;
417      /** Add a redact stage to the aggregation pipeline */
418      redact($redact: Document): this;
419      /** Add a skip stage to the aggregation pipeline */
420      skip($skip: number): this;
421      /** Add a sort stage to the aggregation pipeline */
422      sort($sort: Sort): this;
423      /** Add a unwind stage to the aggregation pipeline */
424      unwind($unwind: Document | string): this;
425      /** Add a geoNear stage to the aggregation pipeline */
426      geoNear($geoNear: Document): this;
427  }

549  /** @public */
550  export declare interface AutoEncryptionOptions {
551      /* Excluded from this release type: metadataClient */
552      /** A `MongoClient` used to fetch keys from a key vault */
553      keyVaultClient?: MongoClient;
554      /** The namespace where keys are stored in the key vault */
555      keyVaultNamespace?: string;
556      /** Configuration options that are used by specific KMS providers during key generation, encryption, and decryption. */
557      kmsProviders?: {
558          /** Configuration options for using 'aws' as your KMS provider */
559          aws?: {
560              /** The access key used for the AWS KMS provider */
561              accessKeyId: string;
562              /** The secret access key used for the AWS KMS provider */
563              secretAccessKey: string;
564              /**
565               * An optional AWS session token that will be used as the
566               * X-Amz-Security-Token header for AWS requests.
567               */
568              sessionToken?: string;
569          } | Record<string, never>;
570          /** Configuration options for using 'local' as your KMS provider */
571          local?: {
572              /**
573               * The master key used to encrypt/decrypt data keys.
574               * A 96-byte long Buffer or base64 encoded string.
575               */
576              key: Buffer | string;
577          };
578          /** Configuration options for using 'azure' as your KMS provider */
579          azure?: {
580              /** The tenant ID identifies the organization for the account */
581              tenantId: string;
582              /** The client ID to authenticate a registered application */
583              clientId: string;
584              /** The client secret to authenticate a registered application */
585              clientSecret: string;
586              /**
587               * If present, a host with optional port. E.g. "example.com" or "example.com:443".
588               * This is optional, and only needed if customer is using a non-commercial Azure instance
589               * (e.g. a government or China account, which use different URLs).
590               * Defaults to "login.microsoftonline.com"
591               */
592              identityPlatformEndpoint?: string | undefined;
593          } | {
594              /**
595               * If present, an access token to authenticate with Azure.
596               */
597              accessToken: string;
598          } | Record<string, never>;
599          /** Configuration options for using 'gcp' as your KMS provider */
600          gcp?: {
601              /** The service account email to authenticate */
602              email: string;
603              /** A PKCS#8 encrypted key. This can either be a base64 string or a binary representation */
604              privateKey: string | Buffer;
605              /**
606               * If present, a host with optional port. E.g. "example.com" or "example.com:443".
607               * Defaults to "oauth2.googleapis.com"
608               */
609              endpoint?: string | undefined;
610          } | {
611              /**
612               * If present, an access token to authenticate with GCP.
613               */
614              accessToken: string;
615          } | Record<string, never>;
616          /**
617           * Configuration options for using 'kmip' as your KMS provider
618           */
619          kmip?: {
620              /**
621               * The output endpoint string.
622               * The endpoint consists of a hostname and port separated by a colon.
623               * E.g. "example.com:123". A port is always present.
624               */
625              endpoint?: string;
626          };
627      };
628      /**
629       * A map of namespaces to a local JSON schema for encryption
630       *
631       * **NOTE**: Supplying options.schemaMap provides more security than relying on JSON Schemas obtained from the server.
632       * It protects against a malicious server advertising a false JSON Schema, which could trick the client into sending decrypted data that should be encrypted.
633       * Schemas supplied in the schemaMap only apply to configuring automatic encryption for Client-Side Field Level Encryption.
634       * Other validation rules in the JSON schema will not be enforced by the driver and will result in an error.
635       */
636      schemaMap?: Document;
637      /** Supply a schema for the encrypted fields in the document  */
638      encryptedFieldsMap?: Document;
639      /** Allows the user to bypass auto encryption, maintaining implicit decryption */
640      bypassAutoEncryption?: boolean;
641      /** Allows users to bypass query analysis */
642      bypassQueryAnalysis?: boolean;
643      options?: {
644          /** An optional hook to catch logging messages from the underlying encryption engine */
645          logger?: (level: AutoEncryptionLoggerLevel, message: string) => void;
646      };
647      extraOptions?: {
648          /**
649           * A local process the driver communicates with to determine how to encrypt values in a command.
650           * Defaults to "mongodb://%2Fvar%2Fmongocryptd.sock" if domain sockets are available or "mongodb://localhost:27020" otherwise
651           */
652          mongocryptdURI?: string;
653          /** If true, autoEncryption will not attempt to spawn a mongocryptd before connecting  */
654          mongocryptdBypassSpawn?: boolean;
655          /** The path to the mongocryptd executable on the system */
656          mongocryptdSpawnPath?: string;
657          /** Command line arguments to use when auto-spawning a mongocryptd */
658          mongocryptdSpawnArgs?: string[];
659          /**
660           * Full path to a MongoDB Crypt shared library to be used (instead of mongocryptd).
661           *
662           * This needs to be the path to the file itself, not a directory.
663           * It can be an absolute or relative path. If the path is relative and
664           * its first component is `$ORIGIN`, it will be replaced by the directory
665           * containing the mongodb-client-encryption native addon file. Otherwise,
666           * the path will be interpreted relative to the current working directory.
667           *
668           * Currently, loading different MongoDB Crypt shared library files from different
669           * MongoClients in the same process is not supported.
670           *
671           * If this option is provided and no MongoDB Crypt shared library could be loaded
672           * from the specified location, creating the MongoClient will fail.
673           *
674           * If this option is not provided and `cryptSharedLibRequired` is not specified,
675           * the AutoEncrypter will attempt to spawn and/or use mongocryptd according
676           * to the mongocryptd-specific `extraOptions` options.
677           *
678           * Specifying a path prevents mongocryptd from being used as a fallback.
679           *
680           * Requires the MongoDB Crypt shared library, available in MongoDB 6.0 or higher.
681           */
682          cryptSharedLibPath?: string;
683          /**
684           * If specified, never use mongocryptd and instead fail when the MongoDB Crypt
685           * shared library could not be loaded.
686           *
687           * This is always true when `cryptSharedLibPath` is specified.
688           *
689           * Requires the MongoDB Crypt shared library, available in MongoDB 6.0 or higher.
690           */
691          cryptSharedLibRequired?: boolean;
692          /* Excluded from this release type: cryptSharedLibSearchPaths */
693      };
694      proxyOptions?: ProxyOptions;
695      /** The TLS options to use connecting to the KMS provider */
696      tlsOptions?: CSFLEKMSTlsOptions;
697  }

773  /**
774   * BSON Serialization options.
775   * @public
776   */
777  export declare interface BSONSerializeOptions extends Omit<SerializeOptions, 'index'>, Omit<DeserializeOptions, 'evalFunctions' | 'cacheFunctions' | 'cacheFunctionsCrc32' | 'allowObjectSmallerThanBufferSize' | 'index' | 'validation'> {
778      /**
779       * Enabling the raw option will return a [Node.js Buffer](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html)
780       * which is allocated using [allocUnsafe API](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#static-method-bufferallocunsafesize).
781       * See this section from the [Node.js Docs here](https://nodejs.org/api/buffer.html#what-makes-bufferallocunsafe-and-bufferallocunsafeslow-unsafe)
782       * for more detail about what "unsafe" refers to in this context.
783       * If you need to maintain your own editable clone of the bytes returned for an extended life time of the process, it is recommended you allocate
784       * your own buffer and clone the contents:
785       *
786       * @example
787       * ```ts
788       * const raw = await collection.findOne({}, { raw: true });
789       * const myBuffer = Buffer.alloc(raw.byteLength);
790       * myBuffer.set(raw, 0);
791       * // Only save and use `myBuffer` beyond this point
792       * ```
793       *
794       * @remarks
795       * Please note there is a known limitation where this option cannot be used at the MongoClient level (see [NODE-3946](https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/NODE-3946)).
796       * It does correctly work at `Db`, `Collection`, and per operation the same as other BSON options work.
797       */
798      raw?: boolean;
799      /** Enable utf8 validation when deserializing BSON documents.  Defaults to true. */
800      enableUtf8Validation?: boolean;
801  }

812  /** @public */
813  export declare abstract class BulkOperationBase {
814      isOrdered: boolean;
815      /* Excluded from this release type: s */
816      operationId?: number;
817      /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
818      /**
819       * Add a single insert document to the bulk operation
820       *
821       * @example
822       * ```ts
823       * const bulkOp = collection.initializeOrderedBulkOp();
824       *
825       * // Adds three inserts to the bulkOp.
826       * bulkOp
827       *   .insert({ a: 1 })
828       *   .insert({ b: 2 })
829       *   .insert({ c: 3 });
830       * await bulkOp.execute();
831       * ```
832       */
833      insert(document: Document): BulkOperationBase;
834      /**
835       * Builds a find operation for an update/updateOne/delete/deleteOne/replaceOne.
836       * Returns a builder object used to complete the definition of the operation.
837       *
838       * @example
839       * ```ts
840       * const bulkOp = collection.initializeOrderedBulkOp();
841       *
842       * // Add an updateOne to the bulkOp
843       * bulkOp.find({ a: 1 }).updateOne({ $set: { b: 2 } });
844       *
845       * // Add an updateMany to the bulkOp
846       * bulkOp.find({ c: 3 }).update({ $set: { d: 4 } });
847       *
848       * // Add an upsert
849       * bulkOp.find({ e: 5 }).upsert().updateOne({ $set: { f: 6 } });
850       *
851       * // Add a deletion
852       * bulkOp.find({ g: 7 }).deleteOne();
853       *
854       * // Add a multi deletion
855       * bulkOp.find({ h: 8 }).delete();
856       *
857       * // Add a replaceOne
858       * bulkOp.find({ i: 9 }).replaceOne({writeConcern: { j: 10 }});
859       *
860       * // Update using a pipeline (requires Mongodb 4.2 or higher)
861       * bulk.find({ k: 11, y: { $exists: true }, z: { $exists: true } }).updateOne([
862       *   { $set: { total: { $sum: [ '$y', '$z' ] } } }
863       * ]);
864       *
865       * // All of the ops will now be executed
866       * await bulkOp.execute();
867       * ```
868       */
869      find(selector: Document): FindOperators;
870      /** Specifies a raw operation to perform in the bulk write. */
871      raw(op: AnyBulkWriteOperation): this;
872      get bsonOptions(): BSONSerializeOptions;
873      get writeConcern(): WriteConcern | undefined;
874      get batches(): Batch[];
875      execute(options?: BulkWriteOptions): Promise<BulkWriteResult>;
876      /* Excluded from this release type: handleWriteError */
877      abstract addToOperationsList(batchType: BatchType, document: Document | UpdateStatement | DeleteStatement): this;
878  }
879

904       */
905      ordered?: boolean;
906      /**
907       * Force server to assign _id values instead of driver.
908       * @defaultValue `false` - the driver generates `_id` fields by default
909       **/

974  /**
975   * Creates a new Change Stream instance. Normally created using {@link Collection#watch|Collection.watch()}.
976   * @public
977   */
978  export declare class ChangeStream<TSchema extends Document = Document, TChange extends Document = ChangeStreamDocument<TSchema>> extends TypedEventEmitter<ChangeStreamEvents<TSchema, TChange>> {
979      pipeline: Document[];
980      /**
981       * @remarks WriteConcern can still be present on the options because
982       * we inherit options from the client/db/collection.  The
983       * key must be present on the options in order to delete it.
984       * This allows typescript to delete the key but will
985       * not allow a writeConcern to be assigned as a property on options.
986       */
987      options: ChangeStreamOptions & {
988          writeConcern?: never;
989      };
990      parent: MongoClient | Db | Collection;
991      namespace: MongoDBNamespace;
992      type: symbol;
993      /* Excluded from this release type: cursor */
994      streamOptions?: CursorStreamOptions;
995      /* Excluded from this release type: [kCursorStream] */
996      /* Excluded from this release type: [kClosed] */
997      /* Excluded from this release type: [kMode] */
998      /** @event */
999      static readonly RESPONSE: "response";
1000     /** @event */
1001     static readonly MORE: "more";
1002     /** @event */
1003     static readonly INIT: "init";
1004     /** @event */
1005     static readonly CLOSE: "close";
1006     /**
1007      * Fired for each new matching change in the specified namespace. Attaching a `change`
1008      * event listener to a Change Stream will switch the stream into flowing mode. Data will
1009      * then be passed as soon as it is available.
1010      * @event
1011      */
1012     static readonly CHANGE: "change";
1013     /** @event */
1014     static readonly END: "end";
1015     /** @event */
1016     static readonly ERROR: "error";
1017     /**
1018      * Emitted each time the change stream stores a new resume token.
1019      * @event
1020      */
1021     static readonly RESUME_TOKEN_CHANGED: "resumeTokenChanged";
1022     /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
1023     /* Excluded from this release type: cursorStream */
1024     /** The cached resume token that is used to resume after the most recently returned change. */
1025     get resumeToken(): ResumeToken;
1026     /** Check if there is any document still available in the Change Stream */
1027     hasNext(): Promise<boolean>;
1028     /** Get the next available document from the Change Stream. */
1029     next(): Promise<TChange>;
1030     /**
1031      * Try to get the next available document from the Change Stream's cursor or `null` if an empty batch is returned
1032      */
1033     tryNext(): Promise<TChange | null>;
1034     [Symbol.asyncIterator](): AsyncGenerator<TChange, void, void>;
1035     /** Is the cursor closed */
1036     get closed(): boolean;
1037     /** Close the Change Stream */
1038     close(): Promise<void>;
1039     /**
1040      * Return a modified Readable stream including a possible transform method.
1041      *
1042      * NOTE: When using a Stream to process change stream events, the stream will
1043      * NOT automatically resume in the case a resumable error is encountered.
1044      *
1045      * @throws MongoChangeStreamError if the underlying cursor or the change stream is closed
1046      */
1047     stream(options?: CursorStreamOptions): Readable & AsyncIterable<TChange>;
1048     /* Excluded from this release type: _setIsEmitter */
1049     /* Excluded from this release type: _setIsIterator */
1050     /* Excluded from this release type: _createChangeStreamCursor */
1051     /* Excluded from this release type: _closeEmitterModeWithError */
1052     /* Excluded from this release type: _streamEvents */
1053     /* Excluded from this release type: _endStream */
1054     /* Excluded from this release type: _processChange */
1055     /* Excluded from this release type: _processErrorStreamMode */
1056     /* Excluded from this release type: _processErrorIteratorMode */
1057 }

1131 /** @public */
1132 export declare interface ChangeStreamDocumentCommon {
1133     /**
1134      * The id functions as an opaque token for use when resuming an interrupted
1135      * change stream.
1136      */
1137     _id: ResumeToken;
1138     /**
1139      * The timestamp from the oplog entry associated with the event.
1140      * For events that happened as part of a multi-document transaction, the associated change stream
1141      * notifications will have the same clusterTime value, namely the time when the transaction was committed.
1142      * On a sharded cluster, events that occur on different shards can have the same clusterTime but be
1143      * associated with different transactions or even not be associated with any transaction.
1144      * To identify events for a single transaction, you can use the combination of lsid and txnNumber in the change stream event document.
1145      */
1146     clusterTime?: Timestamp;
1147     /**
1148      * The transaction number.
1149      * Only present if the operation is part of a multi-document transaction.
1150      *
1151      * **NOTE:** txnNumber can be a Long if promoteLongs is set to false
1152      */
1153     txnNumber?: number;
1154     /**
1155      * The identifier for the session associated with the transaction.
1156      * Only present if the operation is part of a multi-document transaction.
1157      */
1158     lsid?: ServerSessionId;
1159     /**
1160      * When the change stream's backing aggregation pipeline contains the $changeStreamSplitLargeEvent
1161      * stage, events larger than 16MB will be split into multiple events and contain the
1162      * following information about which fragment the current event is.
1163      */
1164     splitEvent?: ChangeStreamSplitEvent;
1165 }

1264 /**
1265  * Options that can be passed to a ChangeStream. Note that startAfter, resumeAfter, and startAtOperationTime are all mutually exclusive, and the server will error if more than one is specified.
1266  * @public
1267  */
1268 export declare interface ChangeStreamOptions extends Omit<AggregateOptions, 'writeConcern'> {
1269     /**
1270      * Allowed values: 'updateLookup', 'whenAvailable', 'required'.
1271      *
1272      * When set to 'updateLookup', the change notification for partial updates
1273      * will include both a delta describing the changes to the document as well
1274      * as a copy of the entire document that was changed from some time after
1275      * the change occurred.
1276      *
1277      * When set to 'whenAvailable', configures the change stream to return the
1278      * post-image of the modified document for replace and update change events
1279      * if the post-image for this event is available.
1280      *
1281      * When set to 'required', the same behavior as 'whenAvailable' except that
1282      * an error is raised if the post-image is not available.
1283      */
1284     fullDocument?: string;
1285     /**
1286      * Allowed values: 'whenAvailable', 'required', 'off'.
1287      *
1288      * The default is to not send a value, which is equivalent to 'off'.
1289      *
1290      * When set to 'whenAvailable', configures the change stream to return the
1291      * pre-image of the modified document for replace, update, and delete change
1292      * events if it is available.
1293      *
1294      * When set to 'required', the same behavior as 'whenAvailable' except that
1295      * an error is raised if the pre-image is not available.
1296      */
1297     fullDocumentBeforeChange?: string;
1298     /** The maximum amount of time for the server to wait on new documents to satisfy a change stream query. */
1299     maxAwaitTimeMS?: number;
1300     /**
1301      * Allows you to start a changeStream after a specified event.
1302      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/changeStreams/#resumeafter-for-change-streams
1303      */
1304     resumeAfter?: ResumeToken;
1305     /**
1306      * Similar to resumeAfter, but will allow you to start after an invalidated event.
1307      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/changeStreams/#startafter-for-change-streams
1308      */
1309     startAfter?: ResumeToken;
1310     /** Will start the changeStream after the specified operationTime. */
1311     startAtOperationTime?: OperationTime;
1312     /**
1313      * The number of documents to return per batch.
1314      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/command/aggregate
1315      */
1316     batchSize?: number;
1317     /**
1318      * When enabled, configures the change stream to include extra change events.
1319      *
1320      * - createIndexes
1321      * - dropIndexes
1322      * - modify
1323      * - create
1324      * - shardCollection
1325      * - reshardCollection
1326      * - refineCollectionShardKey
1327      */
1328     showExpandedEvents?: boolean;
1329 }

1431 /**
1432  * @public
1433  * The public interface for explicit in-use encryption
1434  */
1435 export declare class ClientEncryption {
1436     /* Excluded from this release type: _client */
1437     /* Excluded from this release type: _keyVaultNamespace */
1438     /* Excluded from this release type: _keyVaultClient */
1439     /* Excluded from this release type: _proxyOptions */
1440     /* Excluded from this release type: _tlsOptions */
1441     /* Excluded from this release type: _kmsProviders */
1442     /* Excluded from this release type: _mongoCrypt */
1443     /* Excluded from this release type: getMongoCrypt */
1444     /**
1445      * Create a new encryption instance
1446      *
1447      * @example
1448      * ```ts
1449      * new ClientEncryption(mongoClient, {
1450      *   keyVaultNamespace: 'client.encryption',
1451      *   kmsProviders: {
1452      *     local: {
1453      *       key: masterKey // The master key used for encryption/decryption. A 96-byte long Buffer
1454      *     }
1455      *   }
1456      * });
1457      * ```
1458      *
1459      * @example
1460      * ```ts
1461      * new ClientEncryption(mongoClient, {
1462      *   keyVaultNamespace: 'client.encryption',
1463      *   kmsProviders: {
1464      *     aws: {
1465      *       accessKeyId: AWS_ACCESS_KEY,
1466      *       secretAccessKey: AWS_SECRET_KEY
1467      *     }
1468      *   }
1469      * });
1470      * ```
1471      */
1472     constructor(client: MongoClient, options: ClientEncryptionOptions);
1473     /**
1474      * Creates a data key used for explicit encryption and inserts it into the key vault namespace
1475      *
1476      * @example
1477      * ```ts
1478      * // Using async/await to create a local key
1479      * const dataKeyId = await clientEncryption.createDataKey('local');
1480      * ```
1481      *
1482      * @example
1483      * ```ts
1484      * // Using async/await to create an aws key
1485      * const dataKeyId = await clientEncryption.createDataKey('aws', {
1486      *   masterKey: {
1487      *     region: 'us-east-1',
1488      *     key: 'xxxxxxxxxxxxxx' // CMK ARN here
1489      *   }
1490      * });
1491      * ```
1492      *
1493      * @example
1494      * ```ts
1495      * // Using async/await to create an aws key with a keyAltName
1496      * const dataKeyId = await clientEncryption.createDataKey('aws', {
1497      *   masterKey: {
1498      *     region: 'us-east-1',
1499      *     key: 'xxxxxxxxxxxxxx' // CMK ARN here
1500      *   },
1501      *   keyAltNames: [ 'mySpecialKey' ]
1502      * });
1503      * ```
1504      */
1505     createDataKey(provider: ClientEncryptionDataKeyProvider, options?: ClientEncryptionCreateDataKeyProviderOptions): Promise<UUID>;
1506     /**
1507      * Searches the keyvault for any data keys matching the provided filter.  If there are matches, rewrapManyDataKey then attempts to re-wrap the data keys using the provided options.
1508      *
1509      * If no matches are found, then no bulk write is performed.
1510      *
1511      * @example
1512      * ```ts
1513      * // rewrapping all data data keys (using a filter that matches all documents)
1514      * const filter = {};
1515      *
1516      * const result = await clientEncryption.rewrapManyDataKey(filter);
1517      * if (result.bulkWriteResult != null) {
1518      *  // keys were re-wrapped, results will be available in the bulkWrite object.
1519      * }
1520      * ```
1521      *
1522      * @example
1523      * ```ts
1524      * // attempting to rewrap all data keys with no matches
1525      * const filter = { _id: new Binary() } // assume _id matches no documents in the database
1526      * const result = await clientEncryption.rewrapManyDataKey(filter);
1527      *
1528      * if (result.bulkWriteResult == null) {
1529      *  // no keys matched, `bulkWriteResult` does not exist on the result object
1530      * }
1531      * ```
1532      */
1533     rewrapManyDataKey(filter: Filter<DataKey>, options: ClientEncryptionRewrapManyDataKeyProviderOptions): Promise<{
1534         bulkWriteResult?: BulkWriteResult;
1535     }>;
1536     /**
1537      * Deletes the key with the provided id from the keyvault, if it exists.
1538      *
1539      * @example
1540      * ```ts
1541      * // delete a key by _id
1542      * const id = new Binary(); // id is a bson binary subtype 4 object
1543      * const { deletedCount } = await clientEncryption.deleteKey(id);
1544      *
1545      * if (deletedCount != null && deletedCount > 0) {
1546      *   // successful deletion
1547      * }
1548      * ```
1549      *
1550      */
1551     deleteKey(_id: Binary): Promise<DeleteResult>;
1552     /**
1553      * Finds all the keys currently stored in the keyvault.
1554      *
1555      * This method will not throw.
1556      *
1557      * @returns a FindCursor over all keys in the keyvault.
1558      * @example
1559      * ```ts
1560      * // fetching all keys
1561      * const keys = await clientEncryption.getKeys().toArray();
1562      * ```
1563      */
1564     getKeys(): FindCursor<DataKey>;
1565     /**
1566      * Finds a key in the keyvault with the specified _id.
1567      *
1568      * Returns a promise that either resolves to a {@link DataKey} if a document matches the key or null if no documents
1569      * match the id.  The promise rejects with an error if an error is thrown.
1570      * @example
1571      * ```ts
1572      * // getting a key by id
1573      * const id = new Binary(); // id is a bson binary subtype 4 object
1574      * const key = await clientEncryption.getKey(id);
1575      * if (!key) {
1576      *  // key is null if there was no matching key
1577      * }
1578      * ```
1579      */
1580     getKey(_id: Binary): Promise<DataKey | null>;
1581     /**
1582      * Finds a key in the keyvault which has the specified keyAltName.
1583      *
1584      * @param keyAltName - a keyAltName to search for a key
1585      * @returns Returns a promise that either resolves to a {@link DataKey} if a document matches the key or null if no documents
1586      * match the keyAltName.  The promise rejects with an error if an error is thrown.
1587      * @example
1588      * ```ts
1589      * // get a key by alt name
1590      * const keyAltName = 'keyAltName';
1591      * const key = await clientEncryption.getKeyByAltName(keyAltName);
1592      * if (!key) {
1593      *  // key is null if there is no matching key
1594      * }
1595      * ```
1596      */
1597     getKeyByAltName(keyAltName: string): Promise<WithId<DataKey> | null>;
1598     /**
1599      * Adds a keyAltName to a key identified by the provided _id.
1600      *
1601      * This method resolves to/returns the *old* key value (prior to adding the new altKeyName).
1602      *
1603      * @param _id - The id of the document to update.
1604      * @param keyAltName - a keyAltName to search for a key
1605      * @returns Returns a promise that either resolves to a {@link DataKey} if a document matches the key or null if no documents
1606      * match the id.  The promise rejects with an error if an error is thrown.
1607      * @example
1608      * ```ts
1609      * // adding an keyAltName to a data key
1610      * const id = new Binary();  // id is a bson binary subtype 4 object
1611      * const keyAltName = 'keyAltName';
1612      * const oldKey = await clientEncryption.addKeyAltName(id, keyAltName);
1613      * if (!oldKey) {
1614      *  // null is returned if there is no matching document with an id matching the supplied id
1615      * }
1616      * ```
1617      */
1618     addKeyAltName(_id: Binary, keyAltName: string): Promise<WithId<DataKey> | null>;
1619     /**
1620      * Adds a keyAltName to a key identified by the provided _id.
1621      *
1622      * This method resolves to/returns the *old* key value (prior to removing the new altKeyName).
1623      *
1624      * If the removed keyAltName is the last keyAltName for that key, the `altKeyNames` property is unset from the document.
1625      *
1626      * @param _id - The id of the document to update.
1627      * @param keyAltName - a keyAltName to search for a key
1628      * @returns Returns a promise that either resolves to a {@link DataKey} if a document matches the key or null if no documents
1629      * match the id.  The promise rejects with an error if an error is thrown.
1630      * @example
1631      * ```ts
1632      * // removing a key alt name from a data key
1633      * const id = new Binary();  // id is a bson binary subtype 4 object
1634      * const keyAltName = 'keyAltName';
1635      * const oldKey = await clientEncryption.removeKeyAltName(id, keyAltName);
1636      *
1637      * if (!oldKey) {
1638      *  // null is returned if there is no matching document with an id matching the supplied id
1639      * }
1640      * ```
1641      */
1642     removeKeyAltName(_id: Binary, keyAltName: string): Promise<WithId<DataKey> | null>;
1643     /**
1644      * A convenience method for creating an encrypted collection.
1645      * This method will create data keys for any encryptedFields that do not have a `keyId` defined
1646      * and then create a new collection with the full set of encryptedFields.
1647      *
1648      * @param db - A Node.js driver Db object with which to create the collection
1649      * @param name - The name of the collection to be created
1650      * @param options - Options for createDataKey and for createCollection
1651      * @returns created collection and generated encryptedFields
1652      * @throws MongoCryptCreateDataKeyError - If part way through the process a createDataKey invocation fails, an error will be rejected that has the partial `encryptedFields` that were created.
1653      * @throws MongoCryptCreateEncryptedCollectionError - If creating the collection fails, an error will be rejected that has the entire `encryptedFields` that were created.
1654      */
1655     createEncryptedCollection<TSchema extends Document = Document>(db: Db, name: string, options: {
1656         provider: ClientEncryptionDataKeyProvider;
1657         createCollectionOptions: Omit<CreateCollectionOptions, 'encryptedFields'> & {
1658             encryptedFields: Document;
1659         };
1660         masterKey?: AWSEncryptionKeyOptions | AzureEncryptionKeyOptions | GCPEncryptionKeyOptions;
1661     }): Promise<{
1662         collection: Collection<TSchema>;
1663         encryptedFields: Document;
1664     }>;
1665     /**
1666      * Explicitly encrypt a provided value. Note that either `options.keyId` or `options.keyAltName` must
1667      * be specified. Specifying both `options.keyId` and `options.keyAltName` is considered an error.
1668      *
1669      * @param value - The value that you wish to serialize. Must be of a type that can be serialized into BSON
1670      * @param options -
1671      * @returns a Promise that either resolves with the encrypted value, or rejects with an error.
1672      *
1673      * @example
1674      * ```ts
1675      * // Encryption with async/await api
1676      * async function encryptMyData(value) {
1677      *   const keyId = await clientEncryption.createDataKey('local');
1678      *   return clientEncryption.encrypt(value, { keyId, algorithm: 'AEAD_AES_256_CBC_HMAC_SHA_512-Deterministic' });
1679      * }
1680      * ```
1681      *
1682      * @example
1683      * ```ts
1684      * // Encryption using a keyAltName
1685      * async function encryptMyData(value) {
1686      *   await clientEncryption.createDataKey('local', { keyAltNames: 'mySpecialKey' });
1687      *   return clientEncryption.encrypt(value, { keyAltName: 'mySpecialKey', algorithm: 'AEAD_AES_256_CBC_HMAC_SHA_512-Deterministic' });
1688      * }
1689      * ```
1690      */
1691     encrypt(value: unknown, options: ClientEncryptionEncryptOptions): Promise<Binary>;
1692     /**
1693      * Encrypts a Match Expression or Aggregate Expression to query a range index.
1694      *
1695      * Only supported when queryType is "rangePreview" and algorithm is "RangePreview".
1696      *
1697      * @experimental The Range algorithm is experimental only. It is not intended for production use. It is subject to breaking changes.
1698      *
1699      * @param expression - a BSON document of one of the following forms:
1700      *  1. A Match Expression of this form:
1701      *      `{$and: [{<field>: {$gt: <value1>}}, {<field>: {$lt: <value2> }}]}`
1702      *  2. An Aggregate Expression of this form:
1703      *      `{$and: [{$gt: [<fieldpath>, <value1>]}, {$lt: [<fieldpath>, <value2>]}]}`
1704      *
1705      *    `$gt` may also be `$gte`. `$lt` may also be `$lte`.
1706      *
1707      * @param options -
1708      * @returns Returns a Promise that either resolves with the encrypted value or rejects with an error.
1709      */
1710     encryptExpression(expression: Document, options: ClientEncryptionEncryptOptions): Promise<Binary>;
1711     /**
1712      * Explicitly decrypt a provided encrypted value
1713      *
1714      * @param value - An encrypted value
1715      * @returns a Promise that either resolves with the decrypted value, or rejects with an error
1716      *
1717      * @example
1718      * ```ts
1719      * // Decrypting value with async/await API
1720      * async function decryptMyValue(value) {
1721      *   return clientEncryption.decrypt(value);
1722      * }
1723      * ```
1724      */
1725     decrypt<T = any>(value: Binary): Promise<T>;
1726     /* Excluded from this release type: askForKMSCredentials */
1727     static get libmongocryptVersion(): string;
1728     /* Excluded from this release type: _encrypt */
1729 }

1866 /**
1867  * @public
1868  *
1869  * TLS options to use when connecting. The spec specifically calls out which insecure
1870  * tls options are not allowed:
1871  *
1872  *  - tlsAllowInvalidCertificates
1873  *  - tlsAllowInvalidHostnames
1874  *  - tlsInsecure
1875  *
1876  * These options are not included in the type, and are ignored if provided.
1877  */
1878 export declare type ClientEncryptionTlsOptions = Pick<MongoClientOptions, 'tlsCAFile' | 'tlsCertificateKeyFile' | 'tlsCertificateKeyFilePassword'>;

1919 /**
1920  * A class representing a client session on the server
1921  *
1922  * NOTE: not meant to be instantiated directly.
1923  * @public
1924  */
1925 export declare class ClientSession extends TypedEventEmitter<ClientSessionEvents> {
1926     /* Excluded from this release type: client */
1927     /* Excluded from this release type: sessionPool */
1928     hasEnded: boolean;
1929     clientOptions?: MongoOptions;
1930     supports: {
1931         causalConsistency: boolean;
1932     };
1933     clusterTime?: ClusterTime;
1934     operationTime?: Timestamp;
1935     explicit: boolean;
1936     /* Excluded from this release type: owner */
1937     defaultTransactionOptions: TransactionOptions;
1938     transaction: Transaction;
1939     /* Excluded from this release type: [kServerSession] */
1940     /* Excluded from this release type: [kSnapshotTime] */
1941     /* Excluded from this release type: [kSnapshotEnabled] */
1942     /* Excluded from this release type: [kPinnedConnection] */
1943     /* Excluded from this release type: [kTxnNumberIncrement] */
1944     /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
1945     /** The server id associated with this session */
1946     get id(): ServerSessionId | undefined;
1947     get serverSession(): ServerSession;
1948     /** Whether or not this session is configured for snapshot reads */
1949     get snapshotEnabled(): boolean;
1950     get loadBalanced(): boolean;
1951     /* Excluded from this release type: pinnedConnection */
1952     /* Excluded from this release type: pin */
1953     /* Excluded from this release type: unpin */
1954     get isPinned(): boolean;
1955     /**
1956      * Ends this session on the server
1957      *
1958      * @param options - Optional settings. Currently reserved for future use
1959      */
1960     endSession(options?: EndSessionOptions): Promise<void>;
1961     /**
1962      * Advances the operationTime for a ClientSession.
1963      *
1964      * @param operationTime - the `BSON.Timestamp` of the operation type it is desired to advance to
1965      */
1966     advanceOperationTime(operationTime: Timestamp): void;
1967     /**
1968      * Advances the clusterTime for a ClientSession to the provided clusterTime of another ClientSession
1969      *
1970      * @param clusterTime - the $clusterTime returned by the server from another session in the form of a document containing the `BSON.Timestamp` clusterTime and signature
1971      */
1972     advanceClusterTime(clusterTime: ClusterTime): void;
1973     /**
1974      * Used to determine if this session equals another
1975      *
1976      * @param session - The session to compare to
1977      */
1978     equals(session: ClientSession): boolean;
1979     /**
1980      * Increment the transaction number on the internal ServerSession
1981      *
1982      * @privateRemarks
1983      * This helper increments a value stored on the client session that will be
1984      * added to the serverSession's txnNumber upon applying it to a command.
1985      * This is because the serverSession is lazily acquired after a connection is obtained
1986      */
1987     incrementTransactionNumber(): void;
1988     /** @returns whether this session is currently in a transaction or not */
1989     inTransaction(): boolean;
1990     /**
1991      * Starts a new transaction with the given options.
1992      *
1993      * @param options - Options for the transaction
1994      */
1995     startTransaction(options?: TransactionOptions): void;
1996     /**
1997      * Commits the currently active transaction in this session.
1998      */
1999     commitTransaction(): Promise<void>;
2000     /**
2001      * Aborts the currently active transaction in this session.
2002      */
2003     abortTransaction(): Promise<void>;
2004     /**
2005      * This is here to ensure that ClientSession is never serialized to BSON.
2006      */
2007     toBSON(): never;
2008     /**
2009      * Starts a transaction and runs a provided function, ensuring the commitTransaction is always attempted when all operations run in the function have completed.
2010      *
2011      * **IMPORTANT:** This method requires the user to return a Promise, and `await` all operations.
2012      *
2013      * @remarks
2014      * This function:
2015      * - If all operations successfully complete and the `commitTransaction` operation is successful, then this function will return the result of the provided function.
2016      * - If the transaction is unable to complete or an error is thrown from within the provided function, then this function will throw an error.
2017      *   - If the transaction is manually aborted within the provided function it will not throw.
2018      * - May be called multiple times if the driver needs to attempt to retry the operations.
2019      *
2020      * Checkout a descriptive example here:
2021      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/blog/post/quick-start-nodejs--mongodb--how-to-implement-transactions
2022      *
2023      * @param fn - callback to run within a transaction
2024      * @param options - optional settings for the transaction
2025      * @returns A raw command response or undefined
2026      */
2027     withTransaction<T = any>(fn: WithTransactionCallback<T>, options?: TransactionOptions): Promise<T>;
2028 }

2087 /**
2088  * The **Collection** class is an internal class that embodies a MongoDB collection
2089  * allowing for insert/find/update/delete and other command operation on that MongoDB collection.
2090  *
2091  * **COLLECTION Cannot directly be instantiated**
2092  * @public
2093  *
2094  * @example
2095  * ```ts
2096  * import { MongoClient } from 'mongodb';
2097  *
2098  * interface Pet {
2099  *   name: string;
2100  *   kind: 'dog' | 'cat' | 'fish';
2101  * }
2102  *
2103  * const client = new MongoClient('mongodb://localhost:27017');
2104  * const pets = client.db().collection<Pet>('pets');
2105  *
2106  * const petCursor = pets.find();
2107  *
2108  * for await (const pet of petCursor) {
2109  *   console.log(`${pet.name} is a ${pet.kind}!`);
2110  * }
2111  * ```
2112  */
2113 export declare class Collection<TSchema extends Document = Document> {
2114     /* Excluded from this release type: s */
2115     /* Excluded from this release type: client */
2116     /* Excluded from this release type: __constructor */
2117     /**
2118      * The name of the database this collection belongs to
2119      */
2120     get dbName(): string;
2121     /**
2122      * The name of this collection
2123      */
2124     get collectionName(): string;
2125     /**
2126      * The namespace of this collection, in the format `${this.dbName}.${this.collectionName}`
2127      */
2128     get namespace(): string;
2129     /* Excluded from this release type: fullNamespace */
2130     /**
2131      * The current readConcern of the collection. If not explicitly defined for
2132      * this collection, will be inherited from the parent DB
2133      */
2134     get readConcern(): ReadConcern | undefined;
2135     /**
2136      * The current readPreference of the collection. If not explicitly defined for
2137      * this collection, will be inherited from the parent DB
2138      */
2139     get readPreference(): ReadPreference | undefined;
2140     get bsonOptions(): BSONSerializeOptions;
2141     /**
2142      * The current writeConcern of the collection. If not explicitly defined for
2143      * this collection, will be inherited from the parent DB
2144      */
2145     get writeConcern(): WriteConcern | undefined;
2146     /** The current index hint for the collection */
2147     get hint(): Hint | undefined;
2148     set hint(v: Hint | undefined);
2149     /**
2150      * Inserts a single document into MongoDB. If documents passed in do not contain the **_id** field,
2151      * one will be added to each of the documents missing it by the driver, mutating the document. This behavior
2152      * can be overridden by setting the **forceServerObjectId** flag.
2153      *
2154      * @param doc - The document to insert
2155      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2156      */
2157     insertOne(doc: OptionalUnlessRequiredId<TSchema>, options?: InsertOneOptions): Promise<InsertOneResult<TSchema>>;
2158     /**
2159      * Inserts an array of documents into MongoDB. If documents passed in do not contain the **_id** field,
2160      * one will be added to each of the documents missing it by the driver, mutating the document. This behavior
2161      * can be overridden by setting the **forceServerObjectId** flag.
2162      *
2163      * @param docs - The documents to insert
2164      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2165      */
2166     insertMany(docs: OptionalUnlessRequiredId<TSchema>[], options?: BulkWriteOptions): Promise<InsertManyResult<TSchema>>;
2167     /**
2168      * Perform a bulkWrite operation without a fluent API
2169      *
2170      * Legal operation types are
2171      * - `insertOne`
2172      * - `replaceOne`
2173      * - `updateOne`
2174      * - `updateMany`
2175      * - `deleteOne`
2176      * - `deleteMany`
2177      *
2178      * If documents passed in do not contain the **_id** field,
2179      * one will be added to each of the documents missing it by the driver, mutating the document. This behavior
2180      * can be overridden by setting the **forceServerObjectId** flag.
2181      *
2182      * @param operations - Bulk operations to perform
2183      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2184      * @throws MongoDriverError if operations is not an array
2185      */
2186     bulkWrite(operations: AnyBulkWriteOperation<TSchema>[], options?: BulkWriteOptions): Promise<BulkWriteResult>;
2187     /**
2188      * Update a single document in a collection
2189      *
2190      * @param filter - The filter used to select the document to update
2191      * @param update - The update operations to be applied to the document
2192      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2193      */
2194     updateOne(filter: Filter<TSchema>, update: UpdateFilter<TSchema> | Partial<TSchema>, options?: UpdateOptions): Promise<UpdateResult<TSchema>>;
2195     /**
2196      * Replace a document in a collection with another document
2197      *
2198      * @param filter - The filter used to select the document to replace
2199      * @param replacement - The Document that replaces the matching document
2200      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2201      */
2202     replaceOne(filter: Filter<TSchema>, replacement: WithoutId<TSchema>, options?: ReplaceOptions): Promise<UpdateResult<TSchema> | Document>;
2203     /**
2204      * Update multiple documents in a collection
2205      *
2206      * @param filter - The filter used to select the documents to update
2207      * @param update - The update operations to be applied to the documents
2208      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2209      */
2210     updateMany(filter: Filter<TSchema>, update: UpdateFilter<TSchema>, options?: UpdateOptions): Promise<UpdateResult<TSchema>>;
2211     /**
2212      * Delete a document from a collection
2213      *
2214      * @param filter - The filter used to select the document to remove
2215      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2216      */
2217     deleteOne(filter?: Filter<TSchema>, options?: DeleteOptions): Promise<DeleteResult>;
2218     /**
2219      * Delete multiple documents from a collection
2220      *
2221      * @param filter - The filter used to select the documents to remove
2222      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2223      */
2224     deleteMany(filter?: Filter<TSchema>, options?: DeleteOptions): Promise<DeleteResult>;
2225     /**
2226      * Rename the collection.
2227      *
2228      * @remarks
2229      * This operation does not inherit options from the Db or MongoClient.
2230      *
2231      * @param newName - New name of of the collection.
2232      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2233      */
2234     rename(newName: string, options?: RenameOptions): Promise<Collection>;
2235     /**
2236      * Drop the collection from the database, removing it permanently. New accesses will create a new collection.
2237      *
2238      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2239      */
2240     drop(options?: DropCollectionOptions): Promise<boolean>;
2241     /**
2242      * Fetches the first document that matches the filter
2243      *
2244      * @param filter - Query for find Operation
2245      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2246      */
2247     findOne(): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2248     findOne(filter: Filter<TSchema>): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2249     findOne(filter: Filter<TSchema>, options: FindOptions): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2250     findOne<T = TSchema>(): Promise<T | null>;
2251     findOne<T = TSchema>(filter: Filter<TSchema>): Promise<T | null>;
2252     findOne<T = TSchema>(filter: Filter<TSchema>, options?: FindOptions): Promise<T | null>;
2253     /**
2254      * Creates a cursor for a filter that can be used to iterate over results from MongoDB
2255      *
2256      * @param filter - The filter predicate. If unspecified, then all documents in the collection will match the predicate
2257      */
2258     find(): FindCursor<WithId<TSchema>>;
2259     find(filter: Filter<TSchema>, options?: FindOptions): FindCursor<WithId<TSchema>>;
2260     find<T extends Document>(filter: Filter<TSchema>, options?: FindOptions): FindCursor<T>;
2261     /**
2262      * Returns the options of the collection.
2263      *
2264      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2265      */
2266     options(options?: OperationOptions): Promise<Document>;
2267     /**
2268      * Returns if the collection is a capped collection
2269      *
2270      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2271      */
2272     isCapped(options?: OperationOptions): Promise<boolean>;
2273     /**
2274      * Creates an index on the db and collection collection.
2275      *
2276      * @param indexSpec - The field name or index specification to create an index for
2277      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2278      *
2279      * @example
2280      * ```ts
2281      * const collection = client.db('foo').collection('bar');
2282      *
2283      * await collection.createIndex({ a: 1, b: -1 });
2284      *
2285      * // Alternate syntax for { c: 1, d: -1 } that ensures order of indexes
2286      * await collection.createIndex([ [c, 1], [d, -1] ]);
2287      *
2288      * // Equivalent to { e: 1 }
2289      * await collection.createIndex('e');
2290      *
2291      * // Equivalent to { f: 1, g: 1 }
2292      * await collection.createIndex(['f', 'g'])
2293      *
2294      * // Equivalent to { h: 1, i: -1 }
2295      * await collection.createIndex([ { h: 1 }, { i: -1 } ]);
2296      *
2297      * // Equivalent to { j: 1, k: -1, l: 2d }
2298      * await collection.createIndex(['j', ['k', -1], { l: '2d' }])
2299      * ```
2300      */
2301     createIndex(indexSpec: IndexSpecification, options?: CreateIndexesOptions): Promise<string>;
2302     /**
2303      * Creates multiple indexes in the collection, this method is only supported for
2304      * MongoDB 2.6 or higher. Earlier version of MongoDB will throw a command not supported
2305      * error.
2306      *
2307      * **Note**: Unlike {@link Collection#createIndex| createIndex}, this function takes in raw index specifications.
2308      * Index specifications are defined {@link https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/command/createIndexes/| here}.
2309      *
2310      * @param indexSpecs - An array of index specifications to be created
2311      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2312      *
2313      * @example
2314      * ```ts
2315      * const collection = client.db('foo').collection('bar');
2316      * await collection.createIndexes([
2317      *   // Simple index on field fizz
2318      *   {
2319      *     key: { fizz: 1 },
2320      *   }
2321      *   // wildcard index
2322      *   {
2323      *     key: { '$**': 1 }
2324      *   },
2325      *   // named index on darmok and jalad
2326      *   {
2327      *     key: { darmok: 1, jalad: -1 }
2328      *     name: 'tanagra'
2329      *   }
2330      * ]);
2331      * ```
2332      */
2333     createIndexes(indexSpecs: IndexDescription[], options?: CreateIndexesOptions): Promise<string[]>;
2334     /**
2335      * Drops an index from this collection.
2336      *
2337      * @param indexName - Name of the index to drop.
2338      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2339      */
2340     dropIndex(indexName: string, options?: DropIndexesOptions): Promise<Document>;
2341     /**
2342      * Drops all indexes from this collection.
2343      *
2344      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2345      */
2346     dropIndexes(options?: DropIndexesOptions): Promise<boolean>;
2347     /**
2348      * Get the list of all indexes information for the collection.
2349      *
2350      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2351      */
2352     listIndexes(options?: ListIndexesOptions): ListIndexesCursor;
2353     /**
2354      * Checks if one or more indexes exist on the collection, fails on first non-existing index
2355      *
2356      * @param indexes - One or more index names to check.
2357      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2358      */
2359     indexExists(indexes: string | string[], options?: IndexInformationOptions): Promise<boolean>;
2360     /**
2361      * Retrieves this collections index info.
2362      *
2363      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2364      */
2365     indexInformation(options?: IndexInformationOptions): Promise<Document>;
2366     /**
2367      * Gets an estimate of the count of documents in a collection using collection metadata.
2368      * This will always run a count command on all server versions.
2369      *
2370      * due to an oversight in versions 5.0.0-5.0.8 of MongoDB, the count command,
2371      * which estimatedDocumentCount uses in its implementation, was not included in v1 of
2372      * the Stable API, and so users of the Stable API with estimatedDocumentCount are
2373      * recommended to upgrade their server version to 5.0.9+ or set apiStrict: false to avoid
2374      * encountering errors.
2375      *
2376      * @see {@link https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/command/count/#behavior|Count: Behavior}
2377      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2378      */
2379     estimatedDocumentCount(options?: EstimatedDocumentCountOptions): Promise<number>;
2380     /**
2381      * Gets the number of documents matching the filter.
2382      * For a fast count of the total documents in a collection see {@link Collection#estimatedDocumentCount| estimatedDocumentCount}.
2383      * **Note**: When migrating from {@link Collection#count| count} to {@link Collection#countDocuments| countDocuments}
2384      * the following query operators must be replaced:
2385      *
2386      * | Operator | Replacement |
2387      * | -------- | ----------- |
2388      * | `$where`   | [`$expr`][1] |
2389      * | `$near`    | [`$geoWithin`][2] with [`$center`][3] |
2390      * | `$nearSphere` | [`$geoWithin`][2] with [`$centerSphere`][4] |
2391      *
2392      * [1]: https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/expr/
2393      * [2]: https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/geoWithin/
2394      * [3]: https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/center/#op._S_center
2395      * [4]: https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/centerSphere/#op._S_centerSphere
2396      *
2397      * @param filter - The filter for the count
2398      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2399      *
2400      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/expr/
2401      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/geoWithin/
2402      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/center/#op._S_center
2403      * @see https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/operator/query/centerSphere/#op._S_centerSphere
2404      */
2405     countDocuments(filter?: Document, options?: CountDocumentsOptions): Promise<number>;
2406     /**
2407      * The distinct command returns a list of distinct values for the given key across a collection.
2408      *
2409      * @param key - Field of the document to find distinct values for
2410      * @param filter - The filter for filtering the set of documents to which we apply the distinct filter.
2411      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2412      */
2413     distinct<Key extends keyof WithId<TSchema>>(key: Key): Promise<Array<Flatten<WithId<TSchema>[Key]>>>;
2414     distinct<Key extends keyof WithId<TSchema>>(key: Key, filter: Filter<TSchema>): Promise<Array<Flatten<WithId<TSchema>[Key]>>>;
2415     distinct<Key extends keyof WithId<TSchema>>(key: Key, filter: Filter<TSchema>, options: DistinctOptions): Promise<Array<Flatten<WithId<TSchema>[Key]>>>;
2416     distinct(key: string): Promise<any[]>;
2417     distinct(key: string, filter: Filter<TSchema>): Promise<any[]>;
2418     distinct(key: string, filter: Filter<TSchema>, options: DistinctOptions): Promise<any[]>;
2419     /**
2420      * Retrieve all the indexes on the collection.
2421      *
2422      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2423      */
2424     indexes(options?: IndexInformationOptions): Promise<Document[]>;
2425     /**
2426      * Find a document and delete it in one atomic operation. Requires a write lock for the duration of the operation.

2431     findOneAndDelete(filter: Filter<TSchema>, options: FindOneAndDeleteOptions & {
2432         includeResultMetadata: true;

2438     findOneAndDelete(filter: Filter<TSchema>): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2439     /**
2440      * Find a document and replace it in one atomic operation. Requires a write lock for the duration of the operation.
2441      *
2442      * @param filter - The filter used to select the document to replace
2443      * @param replacement - The Document that replaces the matching document
2444      * @param options - Optional settings for the command
2445      */
2446     findOneAndReplace(filter: Filter<TSchema>, replacement: WithoutId<TSchema>, options: FindOneAndReplaceOptions & {
2447         includeResultMetadata: true;
2448     }): Promise<ModifyResult<TSchema>>;
2449     findOneAndReplace(filter: Filter<TSchema>, replacement: WithoutId<TSchema>, options: FindOneAndReplaceOptions & {
2450         includeResultMetadata: false;
2451     }): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2452     findOneAndReplace(filter: Filter<TSchema>, replacement: WithoutId<TSchema>, options: FindOneAndReplaceOptions): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2453     findOneAndReplace(filter: Filter<TSchema>, replacement: WithoutId<TSchema>): Promise<WithId<TSchema> | null>;
2454     /**
2455      * Find a document and update it in one atomic operation. Requires a write lock for the duration of the operation.
2456      *
2457      * @param filter - The filter used to select the document to update
2458      * @param update - Update operations to be performed on the document
